factoid: Prince Andrew came to his father and brought Princess Mary, who is pregnant.
Prince Andrew followed his father's face with an eager and respectful look.
Prince Andrew asked Prince Andrew's father how he was feeling.
Prince Andrew's father said that only fools and rakes fall ill.
Prince Andrew's father said that he is busy from morning till night and abstemious.
Prince Andrew's father said that he is well.
Prince Andrew thanked God for Prince Andrew's father's health.
Prince Andrew's father said that God has nothing to do with his health.
Prince Andrew's father asked Prince Andrew to explain how the Germans taught him to fight Bonaparte by the new science called strategy.
Prince Andrew smiled in response to his father's question.
Prince Andrew said that he needed time to collect his wits.
Prince Andrew said that he has not yet had time to settle down.
Prince Andrew's father cried nonsense in response to Prince Andrew's comment.
Prince Andrew's father shook his pigtail to check whether it was firmly plaited.
Prince Andrew's father grasped Prince Andrew's hand.
Prince Andrew's father said that the house for Princess Mary is ready.
Prince Andrew's father said that Princess Mary will take Princess Mary there and show her over.
Prince Andrew's father said that they will talk nineteen to the dozen.
Prince Andrew's father said that this is their woman's way.
Prince Andrew's father said that he is glad to have Princess Mary.
Prince Andrew's father instructed Prince Andrew to sit down and talk.
Prince Andrew's father said that he understands Mikhelson's army.
Prince Andrew's father said that he understands Tolstóy's army.
Prince Andrew's father mentioned a simultaneous expedition.
Prince Andrew's father asked what the southern army should do.
Prince Andrew's father said that Prussia is neutral.
Prince Andrew's father said that he knows that.
Prince Andrew's father asked what about Austria.
Prince Andrew's father rose from his chair and paced up and down the room.
Tíkhon ran after Prince Andrew's father handing him different articles of clothing.
Prince Andrew began to explain the plan of operation for the coming campaign.
Prince Andrew explained that an army of ninety thousand strong was to threaten Prussia to bring her out of her neutrality and draw her into the war.
Prince Andrew explained that part of that army was to join Swedish forces at Stralsund.
Prince Andrew explained that two hundred and twenty thousand Austrians, with one hundred thousand Russians, were to operate in Italy and on the Rhine.
Prince Andrew explained that fifty thousand Russians and fifty thousand English were to land at Naples.
Prince Andrew explained that a total force of five hundred thousand men was to attack the French from different sides.
Prince Andrew's father did not show any interest during Prince Andrew's explanation.
Prince Andrew's father continued to dress while walking about.
Prince Andrew's father interrupted Prince Andrew's explanation three times.
Prince Andrew's father shouted "The white one, the white one!" to indicate that Tíkhon was not handing Prince Andrew the waistcoat he wanted.
Prince Andrew's father interrupted again saying "And will she soon be confined?"
Prince Andrew's father shook his head reproachfully and said "That's bad! Go on, go on."
Prince Andrew's father began to sing "Malbrook s’en va-t-en guerre. Dieu sait quand reviendra."
The line translates to "Marlborough is going to the wars; God knows when he’ll return."
Prince Andrew smiled at his father's singing.
Prince Andrew said that he does not say it’s a plan he approves of.
Prince Andrew said that he is only telling his father what it is.
Prince Andrew said that Napoleon has also formed his plan by now, not worse than this one.
Prince Andrew said "Well, you’ve told me nothing new."
Prince Andrew's father repeated "Dieu sait quand reviendra. Go to the dining room."
At the appointed hour Prince Andrew entered the dining room.
Prince Andrew was powdered and shaven.
Princess Mary and Mademoiselle Bourienne were awaiting Prince Andrew together with his architect Michael Ivanovich.
Michael Ivanovich was admitted to the table though his position was insignificant.
Prince Andrew generally kept very strictly to social distinctions and rarely admitted even important government officials to his table.
Prince Andrew unexpectedly selected Michael Ivanovich to illustrate the theory that all men are equals.
Prince Andrew had more than once impressed on Princess Mary that Michael Ivanovich was "not a whit worse than you or I."
At dinner Prince Andrew usually spoke to the taciturn Michael Ivanovich more often than to anyone else.
